t = (0:3) / 3
y = f.(t)
scatter!(t, y, color=:black, label="nodes")

p = FNC.polyinterp(t, y)
plot!(p, 0, 1, label="interpolant", title="Interpolation on 4 nodes")

y = f.(t)
p = FNC.polyinterp(t, y)

children.value:
f = lambda x: sin(exp(2 * x))
x = linspace(0, 1, 500)
fig, ax = subplots()
ax.plot(x, f(x), label="function")

t = linspace(0, 1, 4)
y = f(t)
p = FNC.polyinterp(t, y)

ax.plot(x, p(x), label="interpolant")
ax.plot(t, y, "ko", label="nodes")
ax.legend()
ax.set_title("Interpolation on 4 nodes")
fig
The curves must intersect at the interpolation nodes. For

t = linspace(0, 1, 7)
y = f(t)
p = FNC.polyinterp(t, y)
plot(x, p(x), label="interpolant")
plot(t, y, "ko", label="nodes")
legend(),  title("Interpolation on 7 nodes");

children.html: 1/(x−tk)1/(x-t_k)1/(x−tk​)

children.value: . While such errors do occur, they turn out not to cause trouble, because the
cancellation happens in the numerator and denominator. In fact, the stability of the barycentric formula has been proved, though we do not give the details.
